documents.content: The latest audit report for Northwest Regional Health Network reveals a 22% increase in elective spinal fusion claims from patients aged 60-75 during Q3 2023. This surge coincides with new radiographic eligibility criteria introduced in July. File 8832-45A highlights seven cases where pre-authorization was granted despite borderline indications.

Patient ID#PT-33729 (DOB 08/15/1963) was referred to neurosurgery after conservative measures failed for chronic lumbar stenosis. The 60-year-old male underwent successful L4-L5 fusion on 09/12/2023 at Cascade Orthopedics. Physical therapy claims were processed under authorization code GRT4471P.

Provider memo from Dr. Ellen Rhodes at Cascade Orthopedics: Our clinic maintained 98% first-pass approval rate for spinal procedures after implementing the new imaging submission portal. Three denied claims were successfully appealed using the supplemental clinical justification module.

Health Policy Update Bulletin: Temporary prior authorization waivers for post-op physical therapy will expire 12/31/2023. Patients with procedure codes SPF-4 through SPF-7 must submit new treatment plans by 11/15 to avoid gaps in coverage, per directive 2023-45-OP.
